channel.title: Learn to code development. (Using a Server!)
channel.description:
[center]Welcome :)[/center]
I've decided to basically attempt to create the easiest spoon feed possible on how to code a server.
How? Simply making specific things come up with dialogues on how to do some things :)
Purpose: I've come to realize the only way to really begin to learn to code a P server is to use Deltascape as most of the code makes sense to even the most retarded of people and we need a new form of learning. What I plan to do is make this server basically one big-ass tutorial which; may seem stupid to many of you for reasons being, you're good with Java and feel my idea is just stupid (like I care)
Now, how this will work is; log in on tut. Isle, talk to the RuneScape guide for introduction, click the door to go outside to the survival expert - but wait, the door doesn't work? a Dialogue will pop up explaining how to make doors work.
The above is basically what the whole server will be, one big tutorial on learning the basics of a RuneScape Private Server. We're all tired of seeing un-edited sources and to be quite honest, I'm sure many people are tired of seeing server developments that are DeltaScape with the home area changed, promising updates that never happen.
Now, I feel this post should not be locked/deleted as it will serve the true purpose of developing a server as you will have to learn to do [u]everything[/u] your self with help of Dialogues in the server :).
My hopes with this development is that we can reset the RSPS community's and start new sources from scratch. Of course this is not going to be some Pro-coded development that teaches you things that some of our best coders can do, but it will be a start. I see no harm in going back to fail-content servers because deltascape is now looking like a fail server thanks to kids thinking; OMG I HAZ VENGEANCE AND PVP I DID ALL WORK GF IM PRO. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[center]Extra information:[/center]
[center]Server completion: 2% (cleaning everything wont take long, adding the dialogues and options will take me the longest)
What base will you be using?: Figment F2p Pk, It was the best Project Czar until Prima came up with iClarity, it has what I believe to be the best NPCdrop system, it also has no features so there's no leeching.
Why do you feel this will help people?: Basically, I've been noticing with one of my dyslexic friends at school that sometimes words mean nothing but Gibberish and a picture can tell a thousand stories which, Mopar himself even said.
Updates on what I have done: -Cleaned out the auto spawn and doors.CFG -Put the exp at RuneScapes -Log in for first time, start at Tut isle. -All .CFG files cleaned. -Items.CFG has had all equipment stats set to 0, Values reset -Npcs.cfg erased except one which will be used as a guideline on adding more. -starting on cleaning client.java to remove useless bullshit that Czar seems to have. -Dialogues added thanks to B B0yz 4 -Had to replace the items.cfg because it caused an issue -Finished Tutorial Island -Released V1.0 [/center]
One last thing, the rules say I need pictures? Sure thing, I'll post when I finish cleaning :)
Credits: Jeba (Myself for starting this project) B B0yz 4 (helped me get the project moving) (anthony) for his helpful case/packets list (I suggest using to learn things better http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,291645.0.html) Figment (Source) Czar (base)
V1.0 release: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,391947.0.html

item.title: Learn to code development. (Using a Server!)
item.dc:creator: @_jeba `jeba
item.description:
@_jeba wrote:

[quote=“wales 00, post:11, topic:295531”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=391526.msg2917187#msg2917187 date=1250535476]

I've decided to basically attempt to create the easiest spoon feed possible on how to code a server.

Moparscapes community doesn’t allow spoon feeding.

If you read the rest, it’s not really a spoonfeed.
[/quote]
It’s a spoonfeed, no matter if its little or small.

Although you are trying to improve the Runescape private server economy, some of the “leet” members are trying to get 2007 style runescape back into style. Maybe encourage that.[/quote]

If mopar does not allow a server that teaches you the basics of private servers, then I suppose it’s no wonder everyone uses delta nowdays.

If it wasn’t released we’d still be trying to code Project Czars and majority of this community would still be leeching - Oh, wait never mind. This is moparscape: home of leeching.

Anyway, the mods have two choices when it comes to this.

  1. continue seeing idiots releasing sources with home changed around and credits to themself.
  2. actually move on from deltascape and learn how to do more things.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 04:06:50 am[/size][hr]Almost ready to release V1.0[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 18, 2009, 05:31:25 am[/size][hr]updated, released

Read full topic

item.source: Learn to code development. (Using a Server!)

item.title: Learn to code development. (Using a Server!)
item.dc:creator: @_jeba `jeba
item.description:
@_jeba wrote:

The only real issue with my development is I don’t know how to add dialogues lol, it may take some time to learn because RSPS communitys suck so much now that every tutorial is fucking DELTASCAPE -.-…

One of the main reasons I want to make this is;

I’m no great coder, but with everything I learn I want others to be able to learn as well.
Not to mention how forgetful I am, it will also help me in the future :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 16, 2009, 10:17:47 pm[/size][hr]Also, (sorry for double post, I’m used to RSBot how it stacks them together.) after I’m done with the learning development I will be moving on with this exact project to turn it into the closest-to-RuneScape as I can, try to bring back Good old 2005…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 16, 2009, 10:30:49 pm[/size][hr]updated

Read full topic

item.title: Learn to code development. (Using a Server!)
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

The above is basically what the whole server will be, one big tutorial on learning the basics of a RuneScape Private Server. We're all tired of seeing un-edited sources and to be quite honest, I'm sure many people are tired of seeing server developments that are DeltaScape with the home area changed, [b]promising updates that never happen[/b].

Yeah I hope that doesn’t go on with this thread… Seriously new comers need this though. Even myself but don’t make it a noob guide that show you how to use premade codes that aren’t really Java. Lot of people get that confused nowadays, stupid noobs lol.

Read full topic
